title: Man wants to find Babestation model so he can leave her £20,000
text:
Thomas Weir says he hasn’t got long left due to debilitating diabetes and an MRSA infection (Picture: Daily Star)

A man has launched an appeal to help find a Babestation model he spoke to on the phone for a year, so he can leave her £20,000 in his will.

Besotted Thomas Weir, who lives in Milton Keynes, wants to track down ‘Laura Jones’ because ‘she is lovely’.

However, the 50-year-old is keen to stress he isn’t a stalker.

He said: ‘I don’t want to get in touch with her, that’s not me.

‘I think she’ll spend the money wisely and she’s such a lovely person, she is a loon – very funny.

‘My nephews and nieces all live abroad and are doing very well. I have no children and there is no one else I would like to leave the money to.’

Pensioner waved his penis at neighbours every time they opened their blinds

Thomas feels he doesn’t have long left, due to debilitating diabetes and an MRSA infection, so wants to get the money to Laura, believed to be 41, as quickly as he can.

Advertisement

He says that ‘Laura’ used to wear her hair in pigtails and had links to Pumpkin Film Production.

The company used to be based on Ebenezer Street, to the east of Bristol.

Thomas believes the model could have left the city by now and her former profession – but he’s hoping her family could still live in the area.

He will not be able to leave his money to ‘Laura’ unless she can be properly identified.

Graham Southorn, a legacy planner for Maplebrook Wills, said: ‘For someone to receive inheritance as much information as is required to identify the beneficiary.

‘The executors of a will have to be able to find the intended beneficiary – they can be held personally liable if a claim is made. So they need enough information to do that.’

description: Besotted Thomas Weir, is keen to stress he 'is not a stalker'.
